page.title: 12ARCHAEOLOGY DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content: Apart from ancient roadways listed on p.11, there is:-1. an extensive Roman/British settlement lying within the area 200710-20671 & 200724-206724. A Roman well at the junction of the harepath and the track from Aldbourne,(nos. 2&4 p.11)206713. This was excavated to a depth of 52 feet, but not to the bottom;2-A ditch runs South 222740-240715 nearly parallel to track slopes of scarp above Og Valley, and along W.facing hillside E.of track from harepath to Ramsbury(no.3 p.11)The latter may be a medieval settlement, but this has not been established. Disused marl pits, isolated wells and ponds at 226724,215725,209718, suggest past farming methods, disused dwelling sites, and the use of the main tracks for droving- the name Stock Lane supports this.
